data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3567772,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-25T03:25:16.668Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eMy team uses magicbot for robotpy, and we want to use an equivalent of addPeriodic, even though we aren’t using TimedRobot. We’ve tried adding a notifier, and it caused severe loop overruns, and the addPeriodic method doesn’t seem possible to implement, so I’m unsure how to go about running some section of code at I higher refresh rate. Certainly could consider it for 2026 – I’d like to use pure python robot base classes in the near future, so refactoring magicbot at the same time might make sense.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eIt should definitely be pointed out that if your robot is doing a non-trivial amount of work, you’ll likely find running python code faster on the roborio is a really bad idea since the roborio already can barely keep
